intro: Micranthes fallax, commonly known as the narrowleaf pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
